awd_abstract_narration: The quality of undergraduate engineering education at this                   institution is improved through the acquisition of state-of-the-art             Computer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM) equipment. An already existing          CIM laboratory is enhanced through the addition of a pneumatic robot,           an automated storage and retrieval system, loop conveyor, programmable          conveyor, CNC mill, servo robot controler, vision system, bar code              reader, computer interfaces and associated software.                                                                                                               This enhanced laboratory permits the teaching of CNC machine                 programming, application of vision in manufacturing, principles of              programmable logic controllers, integration of materials handling in            manufacturing, local area networking, and human aspects of automated            manufacturing.                                                                                                                                                     This award is being matched by an equal sum from the grantee.
